title: Self-Directed English Proficiency Enhancement Program Reflecting Socio-Technical Contexts in Engineering Fields

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level engineering expertise, basic English communication skills, and foundational understanding of the impact of technological advancements on society, economy, and culture
context.additional_context: Providing a mobile-based personalized learning environment to strengthen workplace relevance for current professionals, including case studies on how engineering technologies impact social change and civic rights.

learning_goals: The learner selects at least three English-language engineering papers/reports, applies a three-step reading strategy (keyword extraction, logical structure mapping, technical terminology organization), summarizes core content (e.g., societal impact of technological development, economic effects), and writes a report accurately identifying at least 80% of key arguments.

The learner establishes and implements a self-directed learning plan on a mobile platform with an 80%+ completion rate, exploring additional resources on cultural acceptance of engineering technology and global collaboration strategies.

The learner revises engineering presentation materials in English by incorporating feedback from at least three peers, improving the structure (introduction-body-conclusion) and expression (technical terminology, visual aids) by 80%+, and includes an analysis of how technological advancements affect human relationships and social systems.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
